logic

Class LoginConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.LoginConnector

  • public class LoginConnector
extends Object
    Author:
    aamandajuhl and sofieamalielandt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LoginConnector()
      Creates and initializes a newly created UserMapper for further use in methods.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      User getUser(String username) 
      boolean isValid(String username, String password)
      Compares the strings username and password to all the User's in the database, the result is true, if and only if the argument is not null and the username and password represents the same username and password as an User in the database.
      String updateUser(User user, String username, String email, String newpassword, String oldpassword)
      Compares the string username to all the User's username in the database, and compares oldpassword to all the User's password in the database - If and only if the a User is not null and the username and oldpassword represents the same username and password as an User in the database, is the User's data updated.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public LoginConnector()
               throws SQLException
        Creates and initializes a newly created UserMapper for further use in methods.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if initializing not possible

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(String username,
                       String password)
                throws SQLException
        Compares the strings username and password to all the User's in the database, the result is true, if and only if the argument is not null and the username and password represents the same username and password as an User in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - a string
        password - a string
        Returns:
        true if the given username and password represents a User equivalent to this a User in the database. false otherwise
        Throws:
        SQLException - if retrieval of Users's is not possible

      • getUser

        public User getUser(String username)
             throws SQLException
        Parameters:
        username - is used to detect the specific User
        Returns:
        an object from the class User
        Throws:
        SQLException - if retrieval not possible
        See Also:
        UserMapper.getUser(java.lang.String)

      • updateUser

        public String updateUser(User user,
                         String username,
                         String email,
                         String newpassword,
                         String oldpassword)
                  throws SQLException
        Compares the string username to all the User's username in the database, and compares oldpassword to all the User's password in the database - If and only if the a User is not null and the username and oldpassword represents the same username and password as an User in the database, is the User's data updated.
        Parameters:
        user - an object from the class User - the User to be updated
        username - a string
        email - a string
        oldpassword - a string - to compare to User's current password
        newpassword - a string
        Returns:
        a String telling whether or not the update was successful
        Throws:
        SQLException - if retrieval of Users's or update of User is not possible
        See Also:
        UserMapper.updateUser(logic.User)
